Description: Pottery drum. Wheel-turned pottery vessel with rounded body and narrow ridged foot. Neck is slightly everted.Skin membrane stretched across metal ring and secured around pot with twisted fibre cords. These are secured at the foot of the drum through a second heavy metal ring. Outer surface of pot decorated with incised lines and short stab marks. Series of bosses applied around top of foot of drum. Double line of inscription runs along one side of the pottery body.
Acquisition notes: Acquisition details unknown. Found un-numbered in 2014. Label associated with drum reads: 'Rare pottery drum. East Africa with Arabic inscription' 'Egypt' , 'Lot 188'
